TITLE: Meta Bind Button to Increment Metadata
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that increments a metadata field (count) by 1, ensuring it doesn't exceed 10. It uses the 'updateMetadata' action with 'evaluate: true' to execute the JavaScript expression.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: "+1"
hidden: true
id: "count-increment"
style: default
actions:
  - type: updateMetadata
    bindTarget: count
    evaluate: true
    value: Math.min(10, x + 1)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Table with Obsidian Meta Bind API (JS)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet uses the `obsidian-meta-bind-plugin` API to create a dynamic table. It defines `tableOptions` which specify the data source (frontmatter 'activities'), table headers, and editable columns with specific input types (time and inline select) bound to properties within each 'activity' item.  It then creates a `mountable` object, wraps it in an MDRC (Meta Data Render Component) and mounts it to the `container`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/Activity Tracker.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const mb = engine.getPlugin('obsidian-meta-bind-plugin').api;

const tableOptions = {
	bindTarget: mb.createBindTarget('frontmatter', context.file.path, ['activities']),
	tableHead: ['From', 'To', 'Activity', 'Status'],
	columns: [
		'INPUT[time:scope^from]',
		'INPUT[time:scope^to]',
		'INPUT[inlineSelect(option(youtube), option(sudying), option(linch)):scope^activity]',
		'INPUT[inlineSelect(option(-, unproductive), option(0, normal), option(+, productive)):scope^status]',
	],
};

const mountable = mb.createTableMountable(context.file.path, tableOptions);

mb.wrapInMDRC(mountable, container, component);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Toggle Field Rendering with Obsidian Meta Bind (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet creates a toggle field that dynamically switches between a text input and a read-only view based on the 'locked' metadata value. It uses the Obsidian Meta Bind plugin API to parse a bind target, create inline fields, and manage the component's lifecycle. The `mb.wrapInMDRC` function renders the field within the specified container. Reactive rendering is managed via `engine.reactive` and `mb.subscribeToMetadata`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/Using JS Engine for Complex things.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const mb = engine.getPlugin('obsidian-meta-bind-plugin').api;
// a component for lifecycle management of the fields created in our render function
const comp = new obsidian.Component(component);

// create a bind target to the property that we care about
const bindTarget = mb.parseBindTarget('locked', context.file.path);

// the render function, it takes the locked value as the argument
function render(value) {
	// first we unload the component to unload the content from the previous rerender
	comp.unload();
	// then we load the component again for this rerender.
	comp.load();
	// then we empty the element we render to to remove content created in the previous rerender
	container.empty();

	// next we create the field based on the locked value
	let field;
	if (value) {
		field = mb.createInlineFieldFromString("VIEW[{text}][text]", context.file.path, undefined);
	} else {
		field = mb.createInlineFieldFromString("INPUT[text:text]", context.file.path, undefined);
	}

	// and finally we render that field
	mb.wrapInMDRC(field, container, comp);
}

// we create a reactive component from the render function and the initial value will be the value of the bind target
const reactive = engine.reactive(render, mb.getMetadata(bindTarget));

// then we subscribe to the metadata that the bind target points to and rerender the reactive component everythime the bind target value changes
const subscription = mb.subscribeToMetadata(
	bindTarget,
	component,
	(value) => reactive.refresh(value)
);

return reactive;
```

TITLE: Meta Bind Button Configuration - Replace Self with Templater Template (Wiki Link)
DESCRIPTION: This configuration creates a Meta Bind Button that, when clicked, replaces itself with a wikilink to a Templater template.  The `replacement` field specifies the wikilink to the template. `templater: true` ensures the linked template is rendered by the Templater plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Templater Buttons.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: Insert Text
hidden: false
class: ""
tooltip: ""
id: ""
style: default
action:
  type: "replaceSelf"
  replacement: "[[Templater Template]]"
  templater: true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Slider Input with Labels and Range
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates a slider input field using the `INPUT` tag in Meta Bind. It sets the minimum and maximum values to 1 and 10, respectively, and adds labels. The slider is bound to the `slider1` frontmatter property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Examples.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[slider(addLabels, minValue(1), maxValue(10)):slider1]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Reactive Metadata Retrieval for Year Fields (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses Obsidian Meta Bind plugin API to reactively retrieve the 'from_year' and 'to_year' metadata fields.  It parses bind targets for both fields using `mb.parseBindTarget`.  The `mb.reactiveMetadata` function is used to create a reactive component that returns an array containing the values of the two fields, updating whenever either field changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/Using JS Engine for Complex things.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Grab metabind API and extract metadata fields
const mb     = engine.getPlugin('obsidian-meta-bind-plugin').api;
const mbFrom = mb.parseBindTarget('from_year', context.file.path);
const mbTo   = mb.parseBindTarget('to_year', context.file.path);

return mb.reactiveMetadata([mbFrom, mbTo], component, (from, to) => {
	return [from, to]
})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Inline Select Input with Options and Escape Characters
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates an inline select input with two options. It uses the `inlineSelect` input type and defines options with values and display text. The second option includes an escaped backslash. It binds to the `inlineSelect` frontmatter property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Examples.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[inlineSelect(option(0, 'don't do this'), option(1, 'do this \\'), showcase):inlineSelect]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Create Enemy Table Mountable with Meta Bind API (js-engine)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet uses the Obsidian Meta Bind plugin API to create a table that dynamically displays and edits enemy data from the frontmatter of a file. It defines table options, including column definitions that use input fields for text, numbers, and select dropdowns. The created table mountable is then wrapped in a Markdown Render Child (MDRC) and added to the container and component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/PF2e Encounter Calculator.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const mb = engine.getPlugin('obsidian-meta-bind-plugin').api;

const tableOptions = {
	bindTarget: mb.createBindTarget('frontmatter', context.file.path, ['enemy']),
	tableHead: ['Name', 'Level', 'Variant', 'Count'],
	columns: [
		'INPUT[text:scope^name]',
		'INPUT[number(class(meta-bind-small-width)):scope^level]',
		'INPUT[inlineSelect(option(-1, weak), option(0, normal), option(1, elite)):scope^variant]',
		'INPUT[number(class(meta-bind-small-width)):scope^count]',
	],
};

const mountable = mb.createTableMountable(context.file.path, tableOptions);

mb.wrapInMDRC(mountable, container, component);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Binding Input to Per-File Memory Cache
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates binding an input field to a per-file in-memory cache using the Obsidian Meta Bind plugin. The `INPUT` component is used with the `text` type and a key of `memory^test` within the per-file memory scope.  The data will be stored and available only within the current file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Alternative Metadata Storage/Other Note.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
`INPUT[text:memory^test]`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining an inline list suggester with allowOther
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an inline list suggester with the `allowOther` option. The user can enter values not present in suggestions. It retrieves options using `optionQuery(#example-note)` and defines static `option(something, other)`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/List.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[inlineListSuggester(optionQuery(#example-note), option(something, other), allowOther):list5]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculate and Save Result using Meta-Bind
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to bind values from the frontmatter, perform a calculation, and save the result back to the frontmatter. It uses the `engine.markdown.create` function to create a markdown string containing the calculated value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/View Fields/JS View Field.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
{number1} as n1
{number2} as n2
save to {result}
---
return engine.markdown.create(`**${context.bound.n1 * context.bound.n2}** km`);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Bind Button to Open Internal Link
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that opens an internal link within Obsidian when clicked. The 'action' property is of type 'open' and specifies the link to open using Obsidian's internal link syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
style: primary
id: open-button
hidden: true
label: Open File
action:
  type: open
  link: "[[View Fields/Other Note|Other Note]]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Bind Button to Switch to Dark Mode
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that switches the Obsidian theme to dark mode when clicked. It uses the 'command' action type to execute the 'theme:use-dark' command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: Switch to Dark Mode
hidden: false
id: ""
style: primary
actions:
  - type: command
    command: theme:use-dark
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Calculating and Displaying Skill Modifier
DESCRIPTION: Calculates the skill modifier by multiplying the proficiency level with the proficiency modifier (`PROF_mod`) and adding the corresponding ability modifier stored in memory (e.g., `memory^DEX_mod` for Acrobatics). The result is then displayed. Uses the floor function to round the result to the nearest integer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/DnD 5e Ability Scores and Modifiers.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[floor({proficiency.acrobatics}*{PROF_mod})+{memory^DEX_mod}]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[floor({proficiency.arcana}*{PROF_mod})+{memory^INT_mod}]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[floor({proficiency.deception}*{PROF_mod})+{memory^CHR_mod}]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[floor({proficiency.perception}*{PROF_mod})+{memory^WIS_mod}]
```

TITLE: MultiSelect Input Binding with Mixed Types
DESCRIPTION: Defines a multiSelect input that utilizes numeric, boolean and null options. It further demonstrates the plugin's capability to handle different data types in a multiSelect input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Select and Multi Select.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[multiSelect(
option(1, option 1), 
option(false, option 2), 
option(null, option 3), 
showcase
):multiSelect3]
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Suggester with Static Options
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a simple suggester with predefined options. The `suggester` function takes a list of `option()` calls to define the available choices. The `showcase` parameter displays the suggester in the user interface. The result will be assigned to the `suggest` variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Suggester.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[suggester(
option(option 1),
option(option 2),
option(option 3),
showcase
):suggest]
```

TITLE: Replace Other Text in Note with Meta Bind Button
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines a meta-bind-button that replaces a specified range of lines (fromLine to toLine) in the note with a provided replacement string. It uses the `replaceInNote` action type, similar to the previous example, but with a different replacement string. This demonstrates replacing the 'other text tada' block.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Replace Buttons.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: meta-bind-button
CODE:
```
```meta-bind-button
label: Replace Other in Note
hidden: false
class: ""
tooltip: ""
id: ""
style: default
action:
  type: "replaceInNote"
  fromLine: 3
  toLine: 5
  replacement: "other\ntext\ntada"
```
```

TITLE: Defining Proficiency Modifier Input
DESCRIPTION: Creates a number input field to define the proficiency modifier (`PROF_mod`). The user can enter any numerical value.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/DnD 5e Ability Scores and Modifiers.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[number:PROF_mod]
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Suggester with Allow Other Option
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to configure the suggester to allow the user to enter values not present in the predefined list. The `allowOther` parameter enables this functionality. The `showcase` parameter displays the suggester. The result will be assigned to the `suggest` variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Suggester.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[suggester(
option(option 1),
option(option 2),
option(option 3),
allowOther,
showcase
):suggest]
```

TITLE: Text Input with Showcase Property
DESCRIPTION: This example shows a text input field bound to a nested frontmatter property. It uses the `text` input type and the `showcase` property (unspecified function of showcase). It binds to the `object` property within the `nested` frontmatter object.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Examples.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[text(showcase):nested["object"]]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Slider with Custom Min/Max - Meta-Bind (slider2)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define custom minimum and maximum values for a slider using the meta-bind plugin. The `minValue()` and `maxValue()` options are used to set the slider's range. This example binds to the 'slider2' variable from the frontmatter and includes labels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Slider.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[slider(addLabels, minValue(-20), maxValue(20), showcase):slider2]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Slider with Custom Step Size - Meta-Bind
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to set a custom step size for a slider using the meta-bind plugin. The `stepSize()` option specifies the increment by which the slider value changes. The slider is bound to the 'slider4' variable from the frontmatter and utilizes labels, as well as custom min and max values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Slider.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[slider(addLabels, minValue(0), maxValue(10), stepSize(0.1), showcase):slider4]
```

TITLE: Slider with Custom Min/Max - Meta-Bind (slider3)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define custom minimum and maximum values for a slider using the meta-bind plugin. The `minValue()` and `maxValue()` options are used to set the slider's range. This example binds to the 'slider3' variable from the frontmatter and includes labels.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Slider.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[slider(addLabels, minValue(0), maxValue(1000), showcase):slider3]
```

TITLE: Date Input using Meta Bind Plugin
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a date input field using the Meta Bind plugin. It utilizes the `INPUT[date(showcase):date1]` syntax to bind the input to the `date1` property and display it within the "showcase" group.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Date and Time.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[date(showcase):date1]
```

TITLE: Defining a list suggester with option query
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a list suggester input using the meta-bind plugin. It uses `listSuggester` and the `optionQuery` function to retrieve options that match `#example-note`. The `showcase` option enables a visually appealing presentation. It binds to the variable `list2`. The `VIEW` tag displays the variable `list2` as links.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/List.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[listSuggester(optionQuery(#example-note), showcase):list2]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[{list2}][link]
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Inline Select with Time Options
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an inline select element using the Meta-Bind plugin. It uses the `inlineSelect` function with two time-based options ('1 hour' and '2 hours') and corresponding display values ('a' and 'b'). The selected value is bound to the `select3` metadata field. The `showcase` parameter affects how options are rendered.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Inline Select.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[inlineSelect(option(1 hour, a), option(2 hours, b), showcase):select3]
```

TITLE: Meta Bind Text Input with Limit
DESCRIPTION: Defines a text input with a character limit using the Meta Bind plugin.  This binds the input to the 'text' variable and limits the input to 10 characters using 'limit(10)'. It also uses 'showcase' to possibly define a showcase display setting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Text.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[text(showcase, limit(10)):text]
```

TITLE: Time Input using Meta Bind Plugin
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates creating a time input field using the Meta Bind plugin. It utilizes the `INPUT[time(showcase):time]` syntax to bind the input to the `time` property and display it within the "showcase" group.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Date and Time.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[time(showcase):time]
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Number Input with Placeholder and Default Value
DESCRIPTION: Creates a number input field bound to the 'number3' property, with a placeholder text 'test' and a default value of -1. This shows how to customize the input field's appearance and provide a fallback value if the property is initially undefined.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Number.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[number(showcase, placeholder(test), defaultValue(-1)):number3]
```

TITLE: Defining an inline list suggester with options
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an inline list suggester input using the meta-bind plugin. It uses `inlineListSuggester`, `optionQuery` to retrieve options matching `#example-note`, and `option(something, other)` to provide additional options. `useLinks(false)` disables links and `showcase` enhances the display. The input binds to the variable `list4`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/List.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[inlineListSuggester(optionQuery(#example-note), option(something, other), useLinks(false), showcase):list4]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[inlineListSuggester(optionQuery(#example-note), option(something, other), useLinks(false)):list4]
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Toggle with Custom On/Off Values
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates creating a toggle that maps to numerical values (1 and 0) instead of booleans using the Meta Bind plugin. The 'onValue' parameter sets the Obsidian property 'toggle2' to 1 when the toggle is on and 'offValue' sets it to 0 when the toggle is off. The 'defaultValue' ensures the initial value of 'toggle2' is 1 if it's not already defined.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Toggle.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[toggle(showcase, onValue(1), offValue(0), defaultValue(1)):toggle2]
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Input Binding for Editor
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta-Bind input binding. It maps the content of an editor (presumably within Obsidian) to a variable or field named 'editor'. The 'showcase' modifier might indicate that this input is intended for demonstration or display purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Editor.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Meta-Bind
CODE:
```
```meta-bind
INPUT[editor(showcase):editor]
```
```

TITLE: Replace Text in Note with Meta Bind Button

SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Replace Buttons.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: meta-bind-button

```meta-bind-button
label: Replace in Note
hidden: false
class: ""
tooltip: ""
id: ""
style: default
action:
  type: "replaceInNote"
  fromLine: 3
  toLine: 5
  replacement: "some\ntext\nwow"
```
```

TITLE: Recreate Button with Regexp and Meta Bind Button
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines a meta-bind-button that recreates a previous button using regular expression replacement. It relies on the previous button having been replaced by text. It replaces the 'i am no longer a button nice' text block with the original button's code. It uses `regexpReplaceInNote` action type.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Replace Buttons.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: meta-bind-button
CODE:
```
```meta-bind-button
label: Recreate Button with Regexp
hidden: false
class: ""
tooltip: ""
id: ""
style: default
action:
  type: "regexpReplaceInNote"
  regexp: "i am no longer a button\s+nice\n"
  replacement: |-
    ```meta-bind-button
    label: Replace Self
    hidden: false
    class: ""
    tooltip: ""
    id: ""
    style: default
    action:
      type: "replaceSelf"
      replacement: "i am no longer a button\n\nnice"
    ```
```
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[multiSelect(
option(option 1), 
option(option 2), 
option(option 3), 
option(option 3), 
option(option 2), 
showcase
):multiSelect2]
```

TITLE: Viewing Per-File Memory Cache Value
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to display the value stored in the per-file in-memory cache using the `VIEW` component. It references the same `memory^test` key as the input field and the static text "123" before the cached value. The  `text:memory^test123` represents displaying the value with that key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Alternative Metadata Storage/Other Note.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```
`VIEW[{memory^test} 123][text:memory^test123]`
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Suggester with Dataview Query

The `showcase` parameter renders the suggester. This requires the Dataview plugin to be enabled.  The result will be assigned to the `fileSuggest` variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Input Fields/Suggester.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[suggester(optionQuery(#example-note), showcase):fileSuggest]
```

TITLE: Meta-Bind Inline Select with Null Option

TITLE: Calculate Encounter XP with Meta Bind (meta-bind-js-view)
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines a Meta Bind JavaScript view that calculates the total experience points (XP) for an encounter based on the player level and the attributes of each enemy. It retrieves enemy data and player level from the bound context and uses helper function `getXP` to determine the XP value of each enemy type. The calculated total XP is then returned as a formatted Markdown string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/PF2e Encounter Calculator.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
{enemy} and children as enemies
{playerLevel} as playerLevel
---

function getXP(enemyLevel) {
	const diff = enemyLevel - context.bound.playerLevel;
	if (diff === -4) {
		return 10;
	}
	if (diff === -3) {
		return 15;
	}
	if (diff === -2) {
		return 20;
	}
	if (diff === -1) {
		return 30;
	}
	if (diff === 0) {
		return 40;
	}
	if (diff === 1) {
		return 60;
	}
	if (diff === 2) {
		return 80;
	}
	if (diff === 3) {
		return 120;
	}
	if (diff === 4) {
		return 160;
	}
	return -1;
}

function calculateTotalXP() {
	let acc = 0;
	for (const enemy of context.bound.enemies) {
		const xp = getXP((enemy.level ?? 0) + (enemy.variant ?? 0));
		if (xp === -1) {
			return -1;
		}
		acc += xp * (enemy.count ?? 0);
	}
	return acc;
}

return engine.markdown.create(`Encounter XP: **${calculateTotalXP()}**`);
```

TITLE: Reactive Text Update with Obsidian Meta Bind (JavaScript)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet creates a reactive text field that updates based on changes to the 'text' metadata field. It uses the Obsidian Meta Bind plugin API to parse the bind target, create a reactive component using `engine.reactive`, and subscribe to metadata changes using `mb.subscribeToMetadata`. The `onUpdate` function formats the value to string.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/Using JS Engine for Complex things.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const mb = engine.getPlugin('obsidian-meta-bind-plugin').api;

const bindTarget = mb.parseBindTarget('text', context.file.path);

function onUpdate(value) {
	return value.toString();
}

const reactive = engine.reactive(onUpdate, mb.getMetadata(bindTarget));

const subscription = mb.subscribeToMetadata(
	bindTarget,
	component,
	(value) => reactive.refresh(value)
);

return reactive;
```

TITLE: Creating Select Input Field using JS Engine and Meta Bind
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code snippet creates a select input field dynamically using the Meta Bind API within the JS Engine plugin for Obsidian. It defines options for the select field, sets a title, parses the bind target, creates a mountable element, and wraps it in an MDRC (Meta Data Render Component). The code leverages `engine.getPlugin` to access the Meta Bind API, `mb.parseBindTarget` to create the binding target, and `mb.createInputFieldMountable` to construct the input field. The created field will be a block element and bound to the 'select' property of the current file. Dependencies include the 'obsidian-meta-bind-plugin' and 'obsidian-js-engine-plugin'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Meta Bind API.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const mb = engine.getPlugin('obsidian-meta-bind-plugin').api;

const options = ['a', 'b', 'c'];

const arguments = options.map(x => ({
	name: 'option',
	value: [x],
}));

arguments.push({
	name: 'title',
	value: ['I was created using JS Engine and the Meta Bind API'],
});

const bindTarget = mb.parseBindTarget('select', context.file.path);

const mountable = mb.createInputFieldMountable(context.file.path, {
	renderChildType: 'block',
	declaration: {
		inputFieldType: 'select',
		bindTarget: bindTarget,
		arguments: arguments,
	},
});

mb.wrapInMDRC(mountable, container, component);
```

TITLE: Dynamically Update CSS Classes using Meta-Bind
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to dynamically add or remove CSS classes from a note's frontmatter based on the value of `number1`. It retrieves existing CSS classes, adds or removes the `test-class` based on a condition, and saves the updated class list.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/View Fields/JS View Field.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
{number1} as n1
save to {cssclasses}
---
const CLASS = 'test-class';

let classes = new Set(context.metadata.frontmatter.cssclasses ?? []);

if (context.bound.n1 >= 100) {
    classes.add(CLASS);
} else {
    classes.delete(CLASS);
}

return [...classes.values()];
```

TITLE: Resulting Input Field Configuration with JS Engine
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code represents the resulting configuration for the dynamically created input field using JS Engine. It mirrors the previous code snippet, demonstrating the final state of the input field setup. The important aspect is how it reinforces the creation of options 'a', 'b', 'c' and binds them to the `select` target. It showcases the configuration created by the Meta Bind API and JS Engine plugin, making it easier to understand the underlying structure of the generated input field. The arguments include `name` and `value` pairs that drive the select's functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Meta Bind API.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const mb = engine.getPlugin('obsidian-meta-bind-plugin').api;

const options = ['a', 'b', 'c'];

const arguments = options.map(x => ({
	name: 'option',
	value: [x],
}));

arguments.push({
	name: 'title',
	value: ['I was created using JS Engine and the Meta Bind API'],
});

const bindTarget = mb.parseBindTarget('select', context.file.path);

const mountable = mb.createInputFieldMountable(context.file.path, {
	renderChildType: 'block',
	declaration: {
		inputFieldType: 'select',
		bindTarget: bindTarget,
		arguments: arguments,
	},
});

mb.wrapInMDRC(mountable, container, component);
```

TITLE: Calculating Ability Modifiers
DESCRIPTION: Calculates the ability modifier for a given ability score using the formula (score - 10) / 2 and stores the result in memory using the `math(hidden):memory^` syntax. The modifier is calculated using the floor function to round down to the nearest integer. The hidden attribute prevents the value from being displayed directly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Advanced Examples/DnD 5e Ability Scores and Modifiers.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[ floor(({STR} - 10) / 2) ][math(hidden):memory^STR_mod]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[ floor(({DEX} - 10) / 2) ][math(hidden):memory^DEX_mod]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[ floor(({CON} - 10) / 2) ][math(hidden):memory^CON_mod]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[ floor(({INT} - 10) / 2) ][math(hidden):memory^INT_mod]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[ floor(({WIS} - 10) / 2) ][math(hidden):memory^WIS_mod]
```

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
VIEW[ floor(({CHR} - 10) / 2) ][math(hidden):memory^CHR_mod]
```

TITLE: Meta Bind Button to Open External Link
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that opens an external link in the default browser when clicked. The 'action' property is of type 'open' and specifies the URL to open.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
style: default
id: docs-button
hidden: true
label: Open External Link
action:
  type: open
  link: https://www.moritzjung.dev/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin-docs/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Bind Button with Multiple Actions (Sleep, Input)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that opens the quick switcher, waits for 500ms, and then inputs 'PF2e'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: Show PF2e Examples with Delay
hidden: false
id: ""
style: default
actions:
  - type: command
    command: switcher:open
  - type: sleep
    ms: 500
  - type: input
    str: PF2e
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Bind Button Definition
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button with a specified style, label, class, and action. The action is of type 'command' and executes a specific Obsidian command when the button is clicked.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
style: primary
label: Open Meta Bind Playground
class: green-button
action:
  type: command
  command: obsidian-meta-bind-plugin:open-playground
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Date Picker Input Binding to Another Note
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates a date picker input field bound to a different note's frontmatter. It uses the `datePicker` input type and binds to the `date` property in the `other note`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Examples.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[datePicker():other note#date]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Viewing Global Memory Cache Value
DESCRIPTION: This `VIEW` directive displays the value stored in a global in-memory cache. It retrieves the value associated with the key `globalMemory^test123` and displays it as text, followed by the string '456'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Alternative Metadata Storage/Alternative Metadata Storage.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Obsidian Meta Bind
CODE:
```
`VIEW[{globalMemory^test123}456][text]`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Bind Button with Sleep and Input Actions
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that opens the command palette, waits for 1 second, and then types 'help'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: Sleep
hidden: false
id: ""
style: default
actions:
  - type: command
    command: command-palette:open
  - type: sleep
    ms: 1000
  - type: input
    str: help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Bind Button to Switch to Light Mode
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that switches the Obsidian theme to light mode when clicked. It uses the 'command' action type to execute the 'theme:use-light' command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: Switch to Light Mode
hidden: false
id: ""
style: destructive
actions:
  - type: command
    command: theme:use-light
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Text Input with Unicode Characters
DESCRIPTION: This example shows a text input field bound to a frontmatter property with Unicode characters. It uses the `text` input type and binds to the `` (Konnichiwa) frontmatter property.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Examples.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[text:]
```

TITLE: Date Input Binding to Another Note
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates a date input field bound to a different note's frontmatter. It uses the `date` input type and binds to the `date` property in the `other note`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Examples.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: meta-bind
CODE:
```
INPUT[date():other note#date]
```

TITLE: Meta Bind Button with Sleep and Command Actions
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that waits for 1 second and then opens the Meta Bind help.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_13

TITLE: Toggle Input Binding to Toggle1
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates a toggle input field bound to the `toggle1` frontmatter property. It uses the `toggle` input type and uses an empty template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Examples.md#_snippet_10

TITLE: Meta Bind Button with Input Action
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that opens the command palette and then types 'help'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_9

```
label: Input

DESCRIPTION: This command automatically fixes formatting and linting errors, checks for type errors, and runs the tests to improve code quality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```

```

TITLE: Meta Bind Button with Create Note Action
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that creates a new note in a specified folder.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: Create new Note
hidden: false
class: ""
tooltip: ""
id: ""
style: default
actions:
  - type: createNote
    folderPath: templates
    fileName: asdasd
    openNote: false
    openIfAlreadyExists: true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Meta Bind Button with Templater Create Note Action
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a Meta Bind button that creates a new note using a Templater template.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mprojectscode/obsidian-meta-bind-plugin/blob/undefined/exampleVault/Buttons/Button Example.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
label: Templater
hidden: false
id: ""
style: default
actions:
  - type: templaterCreateNote
    templateFile: "templates/templater/Templater Template.md"
    fileName: Button Templater Test
```

TITLE: Meta Bind Button with Inline JS Action

CODE:
